text: Edward Estlin Cummings (October 14, 1894 – September 3, 1962) or best known as E. E. Cummings was an American poet. He is also known for his works as a painter, essayist, author, and playwright. He had created about 2,900 poems, two autobiographical novels, four plays and several essays. E. E. Cummings had done a lot of drawings as well as paintings. He is best known as the preeminent voice of 20th century poetry. == Related pages == *List of poets from North America ==References== * Bloom, Harold, Twentieth-century American literature, New York : Chelsea House Publishers, 1985-1988. . * * Friedman, Norman (editor), E. E. Cummings: A Collection of Critical Essays. * Friedman, Norman, E. E. Cummings: The Art of his Poetry. * James, George, E. E.
